verses.verse: (1 The Church desireth to be joined inseparably to Christ her husband.6 Her deliverance out of the wilderness.) In my bed by (The Church by night, that is, in troubles, seeketh to Christ, but is not incontinently heard.) night I sought him that my soul loved: I sought him, but I found him not.

I will rise therefore now, and go about in the city, by the streets, and by the open places, and will (Showing that although we be not heard at the first, yet we must still continue in prayer, till we feel comfort.) seek him that my soul loveth: I sought him, but I found him not.
The (Which declareth that we must seek unto all of whom we hope to have any succor.) watchmen that went about the city, found me: to whom I said, Have you seen him whom my soul loveth?

When I had passed a little from them, then I found him whom my soul loved: I took hold on him, and left him not, till I had brought him unto my mother’s house, into the chamber of her that conceived me.
(Read Song 2:7.) I charge you, O daughters of Jerusalem, by the roes and by the hinds of the field, that ye stir not up, nor waken my love until she please.

Who is she that cometh up out of the (This is referred to the Church of Israel, which was led by the wilderness forty years.) wilderness like pillars of smoke perfumed with myrrh and incense, and with all the (Hebrew, powder.) spices of the merchant?
Behold his (By the bed is meant the Temple which Solomon made.) bed, which is Solomon’s: threescore strong men are round about it, of the valiant men of Israel.
They all handle the sword, and are expert in war, everyone hath his sword upon his thigh for the fear (He alludeth to the watch which kept the Temple.) by night.
King Solomon made himself a (Or, chariot.) palace of the trees of Lebanon.
He made the pillars thereof of silver, and the pavement thereof of gold, the hangings thereof of purple, whose midst was paved with the love of the daughters of Jerusalem.

Come forth, ye (All ye that are of the number of the faithful.) daughters of Zion, and behold the King Solomon with the (Christ become man was crowned by the love of God with the glorious crown of his divinity.) crown, wherewith his mother crowned him in the day of his marriage, and in the day of the gladness of his heart.
